comments:
I created a model according to the tutorial directions but changed the names of
the package, model, and uri. The java model builds and generates fine. However
when I go to run the model editor I get a ClassNoDef exception when running the
wizard. The names of the directories are: simplemodel, simplemodel.edit, and
simplemodel.editor (all sub-directories of eclipse/workspace.) The
SimplemodelModelWizard (in simplemodel.editor) cannot see the class
SimplemodelPackage. I noted that the .edit and .editor directories had a runtime
sub-directory to store the class files (distinct from the java sources) but the
simplemodel directory did not. Creating the runtime and copying the class files
there created a work-around and the model editor became functional.

Running J2SE 1.4.1_03, Eclipse 2.1, EMF 1.1.0

Stack trace:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.workbench 4 2 Jun 09, 2003 15:39:43.376
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:
"org.eclipse.ui.workbench".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/foliage/emf/simplemodel/SimplemodelPackage
    at
com.foliage.emf.simplemodel.presentation.SimplemodelModelWizard.<init>(SimplemodelModelWizard.java:99)
    at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
...

Sorry, this was operator error. I re-read the tutorial and discovered I should
have specified the output directory to be "runtime". (It appears that this is
currently hard-coded into the EMF plug-in.)

The user must compile into a runtime directory because that's what the 
plugin.xml expects.
